slides.title: Understanding Generative AI
content: Generative AI creates new content.
It learns patterns from vast datasets.
Outputs are novel and diverse.
Key capabilities: text, images, code.
Text (LLMs): Articles, summaries, code.
Image: Art, photorealistic designs.
Code: Assisting developers with snippets.
narration: What exactly is Generative AI?
It's AI that creates brand new content.
Unlike analytical AI, it generates, not just analyzes.
It learns intricate patterns from vast amounts of data.
Its outputs are novel and diverse.
They range across different modalities.
This includes text, images, and code.
For text, think of Large Language Models.
They generate articles, summaries, or even code.
In images, it creates art or photorealistic designs.
Think of tools like Midjourney or Stable Diffusion.
And for code, it assists developers by generating snippets and completing functions.
slides.image_prompt: An infographic clearly defining Generative AI. Visual elements representing text generation (a document icon with abstract text), image generation (a paintbrush and canvas), and code generation (code editor icon).

slides.title: The Rise of Open Source AI
content: Open Source AI: Code and data are freely available.
Contrast with proprietary, closed-source AI.
Benefits: Transparency, customization, community.
Transparency: Audit for bias, understand workings.
Customization: Tailor models for specific tasks.
Community: Fast innovation, global collaboration.
Accessibility: Lower entry barrier, cost-effective.
narration: Now, let's talk about Open Source AI.
Its code and data are freely available for all.
This openness contrasts with proprietary, closed-source systems.
Key benefits include transparency.
Users can audit for bias and understand how models work.
You also gain customization and flexibility.
This enables tailoring models for specific tasks.
A huge global community drives rapid innovation and fosters collaboration worldwide.
Ultimately, Open Source AI makes advanced technology accessible.
It is cost-effective for everyone.
It significantly lowers the entry barrier.
slides.image_prompt: A visual metaphor of a thriving, collaborative ecosystem. Interconnected nodes representing transparency, customization, community, and accessibility. A magnifying glass over code, gears for customization, and diverse people collaborating.

slides.title: Navigating the Open Source AI Toolkit
content: Prominent Open Source LLMs:
Meta's Llama Family: Cornerstone, strong performance.
Mistral AI Models: Efficient, capable, gaining traction.
Open Source Image Generation:
Stable Diffusion: Widely adopted for text-to-image.
Key Frameworks & Platforms:
Hugging Face: Central hub for models and datasets.
PyTorch / TensorFlow: Underlying ML frameworks.
narration: Let's explore key open-source AI tools.
These tools power this revolution.
For Large Language Models, Meta's Llama family is a cornerstone.
It's known for its strong performance.
Mistral AI models are also gaining traction.
They are valued for their efficiency and capabilities.
For open-source image generation, Stable Diffusion is widely adopted.
It offers powerful text-to-image capabilities.
Beyond models, platforms like Hugging Face are central.
They help discover and share models and datasets.
These tools drive new AI applications and innovations.
Underlying all this are foundational frameworks.
Think of PyTorch and TensorFlow.
They provide the building blocks for development.

slides.title: Assignment
content: Visit Hugging Face's website (huggingface.co).
Browse the 'Models' section.
Find one open-source Large Language Model (LLM) or Image Generation model.
Note its name, creator, and a brief description of its primary function.
Think about a simple practical application for this model.
narration: Here is a small assignment for you.
Visit Hugging Face's website; it is a great resource.
Explore the 'Models' section there.
Find any open-source LLM or image model.
Note its details and main function.
Consider a simple practical use case for it.
